vague_description: Finding the optimal parameters for a quadratic model that minimizes error between predicted and observed data values.
detailed_description: Fit the ‘best’ quadratic curve y = c * x^2 + b * x + a to this set of data points. The objective is to minimize the sum of absolute deviations of each observed value of \param{ObservedValues} from the value predicted by the quadratic relationship with \param{ObservedXValues}.
target_objective: Minimize the sum of absolute deviations between the observed values (ObservedValues) and the values predicted by the quadratic function using the observed x-values (ObservedXValues)
target_constraints: The curve is a quadratic function of the form y = c * x^2 + b * x + a
target_parameters: Observed y values at each data point k
Observed x values at each data point k
